channel.title: Got some problems with windows / hdd
channel.description:
Well, These people gave me a computer to fix. Well, basically when you start it it says floppy diskette error or something, strike f1 to continue. Press it it loads windows and when it starts up mouse keyboard doesn't work. Then about 5-10 mins later it give a Blue Error Page (will display below). Well I was just going to take the pictures off (the only thing they wanted) and reformat it with windows. Well, There hdd is SATA and mine only supports IDE.. Any suggestions or anything? I'm clueless...
[IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/142eqzk.jpg[/img]

item.title: Got some problems with windows / hdd
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Lil Goon, post:11, topic:283586”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=374783.msg2825840#msg2825840 date=1244979894]
Try single modules in every slot. Ie, if there are 2 sticks of ram, try each 1 seperately, and try them in both slots. You have bad ram somewhere.
[/quote]
Ok, I’ll try.
EDIT: I took out the first one and it worked fine. But the computer is damn slow.[/quote]

Just buy some more ram, you could probably find 2x1gb sticks for <$20.

Read full topic
item.source: Got some problems with windows / hdd

item.title: Got some problems with windows / hdd
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Lil Goon, post:7, topic:283586”]There are 8 errors[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 13, 2009, 06:03:36 pm[/size][hr]Didn’t feel like typing it all out so I just took pictures.
http://i41.tinypic.com/iqws9u.jpg
http://i43.tinypic.com/2h6zxw6.jpg
http://i40.tinypic.com/juxs05.jpg
http://i39.tinypic.com/2wqhpis.jpg[/quote]
There’s errors in your RAM, try switching sticks with new ones.

Read full topic
item.source: Got some problems with windows / hdd

item.title: Got some problems with windows / hdd
item.dc:creator: @Lil_Goon Lil Goon
item.description:
@Lil_Goon wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:8, topic:283586”][quote author=Lil Goon link=topic=374783.msg2825322#msg2825322 date=1244936784]
http://i41.tinypic.com/iqws9u.jpg
[/quote]
1014mb of RAM? There’s 1024mb in a GB. I am not sure if that’s Memtest fault or there’s something wrong. (It always gets my clock speed wrong)

Can you explain what you mean when you said:

There hdd is SATA and mine only supports IDE… Any suggestions or anything? I’m clueless…

??[/quote]
They want the pics off of the computer, but my motherboard only supports IDE and not SATA (there HDD).

Mopman:

Try single modules in every slot. Ie, if there are 2 sticks of ram, try each 1 seperately, and try them in both slots. You have bad ram somewhere.

Ok, I’ll try.
EDIT: I took out the first one and it worked fine. But the computer is damn slow.

EDIT2: One of the cards are bad. At least the ddr slots arent :.

Read full topic
item.source: Got some problems with windows / hdd

1014mb of RAM? There’s 1024mb in a GB. I am not sure if that’s Memtest fault or there’s something wrong. (It always gets my clock speed wrong)[/quote]
shared memory with the video

item.title: Got some problems with windows / hdd
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Lil Goon, post:5, topic:283586”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=374783.msg2825297#msg2825297 date=1244935044]

Registry error, I bet. Does this occur in safemode?

Uhm, I’ll check didn’t even try.

That’s one of the first steps one takes in diagnosing a computer booting Windows.
[/quote]Ya it happened in safe mode to.[/quote]
Run this
http://www.memtest86.com/
and tell me if there are errors.

Read full topic
